ht2cZe0ma3vWpAJbATZNZA.text: A really good place for food disguised as an awesome Irish pub. Authentic look and feel (we even had an Irish lass as a waiter). The small plates are stars. Avocado Toast is incredible. Nice crispy toast (half slice) with creamy avocado spread, pickled red onions and drizzled with balsamic with good mix of salad greens make this a Star you do not expect at a pub. I paired with the house Caesar Salad which could have used more parm and dressing but was large portion of full romaine leaves. Wife went for smothered chicken and the mushrooms and spinach mix over the top was great. Good service and great Irish live music at night to get you going. They were a little steep for Jameson's doubles ($22ea), but we figured the ambiance was included.

HaqQOTwHYBHvnlDmLylu9w.text: Fish and chips is really good!!! So far only tried 2 menu fish and chips and the hot wings! Both are good! Nice place to chill!

FdW5XhuiPXXz21TjZ8uXvA.text: Great food and a fun, cozy environment. We had the chips & curry sauce for the appetizer and the corned beef and cabbage for the entree. The food was delicious! They had a live band playing, so that was cool. Our server was great too. I'm only rating 4 stars because they were out of some ingredients for both of the mixed drinks we ordered. It is St. Patrick's Day, so they're probably busier than usual, but they had to re-take our drink order twice. We would definitely go again though!

2BM4wWWJUYVsVdOvLZ-Dqw.text: Horrible service. They forgot our drinks, then brought the wrong drinks. One of our party of five had to ask for her meal long after everyone else's meal had been served and the server was bussing other tables. Additionally we had to request silverware and napkins after food had been served. Would NOT recommend.

gVcA-j7KzRg7k8XfMgN5qw.text: I stay at the Mandalay Bay resort and casino almost every time I stay in Vegas. This time, specifically it was for work. I was really excited to try out Rira, as my fiance and his cousin had tried it the day before and loved it. I knew that they opened at a certain time which I believe on weekends is about 9 AM. That particular morning we showed up anxiously awaiting a delicious breakfast and also starving, and the manager said that since there was a soccer game that was going into overtime, we had to wait until the soccer game is finished to come in for breakfast. First of all, when an establishment advertises that they open at a certain time, they should allow patrons to show up at that time. I was furious, it wasn't the hostesses fault, she just shrugged her shoulders and gave us a look as if " I don't make the rules here." I would never recommend this place. I hate False advertisement, and I hate rude and uninviting management. Although, I never got to experience the delicious breakfast aforementioned I still would have a bad taste in my mouth for the service.

iUAs5el-Cg4Hb6N-N_bTHA.text: Considering how much everything costs at Mandalay Bay, this was a bargain. Service was good. Food was decent. Portions were big. We both had fish and chips and were happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uZAEYRnIA0KE6VaB3coWrw.text: Had dinner here twice while staying at Luxor on business trip. Good friendly service but the food tops out at 3 stars - most items were somewhat bland. The fries were blah. Best item we tried was the starter pastry sausage rolls - highly recommend those. Also, they have good beer selection including one of my all time favorites Ol Speckled Hen.

D9PlByNjR3uL9Eq4T79MQg.text: This is a really cute little Irish Pub! At first we weren't that impressed, but we kept going back deeper into the bar, and it turns out it's really cool. They have like 4 different bars inside, and one is in a really cozy room with a fireplace and comfortable chairs and couches. They had an Irish band playing while we were there, and they were really good. It's a great place to stop for a couple of drinks while walking around the Strip!

Pm3W_XQAAmeHaMU1kobpTA.text: I went here for the tea service. I got the Dunbrody, but added a smoked salmon sandwich and everything was sooo good. Portions are generous, prices are reasonable and the environment is laid back and charming. The service was amazing as well! We were fortunate enough to have the very personable (and actually Irish), Martin, as our waiter. Enough said, right? I'll definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Afternoon tea menu

ZhFgp43N9BB0o2EyIYRR1w.text: Exceptional place. Exemplary service from Melissa. Terrific food. I had the Worcestershire Chicken sandwich and it was great. My sister has food allergies and Melissa treated her with lots of care and respect, even reading the mustard bottle for allergens. Ambiance was great - very authentic. It doesn't look like much to write home about as it's in the shopping area but well worth a stop!

cpStguM6j0-BwG2lVjy0PQ.text: What a great authentic Irish Tea Experience!!! Definitely a hidden gem for tea service! I was expecting just a decorated table cloth and tea setting in the pub but they actually have separate room for tea. Really cool atmosphere! Tea setting was beautiful and service was amazing!   Being in Ireland last year, it really felt like we took a step back there! Will definitely come back to try the food, beer and hopefully catch a live band.  If you are looking for a fun afternoon tea experience, this is it! The tea sandwiches were large size and yummy! We had cucumber and egg salad. The tray also included scones and dessert. The tea was delicious! They also serve  Ireland's Barry's Tea.  Our servers were so nice and helpful! They checked on us just enough times, making sure they didn't interrupt too much as they knew we were girlfriends catching up! They poured our tea, went over our treats and were just so friendly!  Price was reasonable at $24, where Others on strip are 35 or 45.  Overall just a great experience! Can't wait to to go back, thinking of having a birthday there in their separate room!

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PUFvt5qdtIN2obwTGNN-Dw.text: I am currently on keto and the traditional breakfast here is perfect! A must.  Obviously sans toast.

0X-t4mivUaBj95cO6yN20g.text: Love this place! We always come here to watch ND football games! The fish and chips is amazing!

PlKOgzUD7WLjTBniYbqB7g.text: Great customer service!!  Fish and Chips were as good as I remembered them being. Green dot whiskey to finish the meal. Excellent!!

NnokqdRUAsllLLpppXb57Q.text: Horrible service, waiter was rushed got half our order then argued with us. Asked for manager she didnt care what was wrong. Racist place will never go back, lucky I didn't dine and dash. Sadly cant give less the one star

xki9NH5d07mjuP-nnsu8WQ.text: Nowadays Vegas food sucks! But this place is great! I loved the Irish artifacts on the walls. Googling the origins and history of that stuff was entertaining. We sat in the area outside the bar. We don't drink and it was a tad too loud for me in the bar area, but the bar patrons were well chuffed with the atmosphere. The food was amazing! Except for that seedy bread we were given to snack on before the meal. That loaf was truly some authentic Game of Thrones original recipe. I opted for the fish and chips. The fish was soooooooooo freaking good but the POTATOES... beyond exceptional. They must have shipped those spuds from Ireland. The tarter sauce was not my favorite but the malt vinegar kept me happy. My husband had the Turkey Avocado Burger and said it was the best turkey burger he has ever had in his entire life. I was too satisfied with my fish to do a taste off.

lmVjiqI7xluCzvTe8sBsUw.text: I came a while back and was pleasantly surprised by the food. We were in a rush and came with a large group so I wasn't optimistic but luckily it worked out. The inside space is huge with lots of sectioned rooms. We tried the potato pancakes, the potato leek soup, the fish and chips, and the corned beef and cabbage. I thought all the food was tasty but the portions were way too much! We easily could've gotten half the amount and been stuffed. We also ended up ordering too many things that had potato as a base so we got full very fast. The fish and chips and the corned beef were my favorites. If you're looking for a quick casual bite this is a great choice.

IBC5upeYVMAR0riP9X9bSA.text: Great selection of beer and the food and service were excellent. The fish and chips are a must have! Reasonably priced

0YS5badrW8wNGv4RF9tYdQ.text: Wanted to continue the new restaurant exploration and this time I've decided to try some Irish food!  I ordered the Guinness stew, fish and chips, and the pork belly with polenta. The stew was decent and it reminded me of pot roast. The portion looks small but is is filling and hearty. For the fish and chips, the fish was lightly breaded so you can actually taste the fish, albeit it doesn't have too much flavor on its own. The tartar sauce was pretty good and helps with adding in much needed moisture and flavor to the dish. Also forgot to mention that the fish was huge! I got full after eating less than half of it lol. The fries were a lost cause. Pretty much soaked and soggy from all that oilZ I had a few pieces and had to call it quits because it was pretty disgusting to see all the oil sweeping out lol. Wish the fries were nice and crispy especially when paying $20+ for that dish. The pork belly was delicious but the polenta it came with was pretty dry and flavorless. I had to scrape the little amount of hoisen sauce they provided to make it edible. The free bread and butter was decent, but the bread itself was really dry and grainy tasting.   Overall the dinner experience was decent. I don't know if I would come back here just because the food wasn't that special to me. I'll be exploring more Irish food at a different establishment to see how they do it.

Py-X-6mItgswaIvvPCDElw.text: Ok so this review is based on the two times that we have been here! Yesterday we came in about 4pm we were seated right away which was great because we were hungry! So we decided to try the potato cakes... all I gotta say is "O"my word. I can't even explain the soft yet crunchy delectable little morsels of potato heaven.. if this is what Ireland food is like I wanna go visit there ASAP! Any-who our waiter COREY was great on helping us select our entrees which me and my husband shared. We got the Ruben sandwich with pub fries so good and we shared the potato leek soup as well another great appetizer.. overall our experience was great all do to recommendations from our waiter Corey!

JKgE5UWJSKDhd95Az4R1ig.text: AMAZING!! Ambiance, food, customer service drink selection.... I am beyond pleased. This place has imported beautiful pieces from Ireland to create the perfect ambiance. During my most recent visit I was met with wonderful energy and probably some of the best customer service I've had in sometime.

t4WlZcafyUTK7hPUOZz7Rg.text: Love the food here and the good selection of beer. Came here on St Patty's day for the All Irish Breakfast and love the fun festive atmosphere with the waitstaff all dressed up and getting in the mood.

GwAugEDdmHSaC0Ti3TpNzw.text: I'm livid, having just come from this place for dinner.    Don't be thrown off by the "reasonable" prices, their miniscule portion sizes are why they charge less for less.    We ordered the sausage rolls app, at $12, they give you 2 tiny sausage covered in filo dough drizzled with sauce.  I saw the plate and knew the rest of the meal was going to be disappointing.  $13 for a burger slider (effectively), and $17 for flavorless shepherd's pie.    Our waitress (Jane) was great, and I want to increase my overall rating for her, but that's what brings it from 0 to 1 star at all.  I don't know why anyone would go here, you're better off eating fast food at McDonald's...  Heed the warning, go elsewhere, less you be disappointed with the meager portion sizes too.

yHD3UOTEdc-dGK_xYfxsiw.text: So thankful this place was open late. I was craving food after a show and decided to pull a spot up at the bar. They have some of the traditional Irish food on the menu, there was a band playing which was pretty good. Hen I saw it, the PB &J Burger.   I'm in love, fried jalapenos and not these pre-breaded rings, hear we're like roasted long strips of jalapeno then tossed in breading and fried. Peanut butter on one side of the bun and jam on the other. This was cooked perfectly. When I have the chance I order y Burgers MR.   service was pretty spot on even for being a busy Sat night. I plowed through like 6 pints of club soda and only had to actually ask for one so that's a big kudos there.

K3iCniLuuEEq8nZNKOX38Q.text: Love this restaurant and have been here twice. Best Steak and live entertainment!  Had avocado toast, Brussels sprouts salad, chicken wings (they were da bomb), a pint and steak. A great birthday night celebration!

Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside of restaurant
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar and table área

4WJQEkFO0Hht_vr18ed6cQ.text: What a disappointment the meal here was. Soggy greasy hand cut fries with a Rueben with little flavor. Couldn't find the sauerkraut in it. The fish In the Fish and chips was also very greasy. It seems whomever was frying tonight couldn't wait for the fry oil to come to temperature and so served oil soaked food. Sorry but we won't be back.

eSlBb27TRrKjSbfc9QrdQA.text: Located in mall area between Mandalay and Luxor  Service 5/5 Food 3/5 (would be 4/5 if it weren't for the steak)  Service was very friendly and helpful, seating was comfortable, and there is live music nightly.  1) Complimentary soda bread and Kerrygold butter (4/5 - server says take the extra bread/butter and makes a good breakfast in the morning - butter can last outside the fridge for a night) 2) Guinness BBQ wings (5/5 tasted better than my steak) 3) Steak (1/5 at something like $28, this steak looks good with the sauce and size and all, but it was horrible, had tons of fat on it on the edges and throughout, and the parts without fat were very tough to chew, could not even begin to enjoy it - wishing I wouldn't have let the server take the extra wings off the table, so I had something to eat) 4) Guinness Stew (4/5 standard) 5) They had Irish food products you could buy such as Cadbury chocolates and Jaffa cakes

wOsp1cmXhTCqnrnJcIi6_A.text: Ok the fish and chips is HUGE and tastes good but I wish the fish was more seasoned.  Service is slow it takes 30min to get the food. The potatoes leak soup is great and so is the bread.

ZF0DLyQK-6TbImhJGBqlXg.text: We hit this place up once a month prior to going dancing and listening to the band Phoenix at the Rhythm & Riff lounge.  Ri Ra always provides us with the best service and are nice enough to do seperate checks on our large groups.  There are many options other than just Irish fare.  Something for everyone.  Live music most nights make for a really fun night.

kJPpj8DTNwqz1BBS1xeVkw.text: This place was way bigger than it looks on the outside very shocked at how big it really was. I thought it was just a small irish pub when I walked by the day before. My cousin had her wedding reception here. It has a great charm to it. Not much room to move around in the back dining room where we were even though we were just a party of a little over 50. The food was really good very tasty.  Something odd happened, the fire alarms were going off while we were in there. The staff looked very confused and they all ran out without telling us if we should be evacuating as well. It turned out to be a False alarm anyway. Would like to come back and try whats on their regular menu since I thought the food they served us was good.

z5mHOpK5qFk7UpLewsRDCA.text: Even though it's in the Mandalay Bay, once you step inside everything else disappears. It's a cozy old feeling bar with beautiful chandeliers & decor all over. Great selection of Irish beers, live acoustic music. I literally felt as if I were to step outside I'd be in a small village somewhere in Ireland with a bit of a chill outside. Wings were great with the Jameson sauce oh man so delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4p812q3Goy_T_E85P8v9yQ.text: Really great pub style food, try the potato cakes, scotch eggs, and sausage rolls.  Also the fish and chips is the size of your head.

g71K0BvNlgyVq7rK3iq8yA.text: Food was pretty good here. I had their pasta cavatappi and it was sooo good. The outside was crispy and the pasta was cooked al dente. Their fish and chips portions were huge and they tasted delicious as well. I heard their corned beef was good but I didn't feel like it that night...   Also they have interesting selections of beers and non-alcoholic drinks including kid's beer, just ask for it.   Service was friendly but they were swamped that night so it took a while before our food came out. I suggest that if you plan to eat there, go there early, ideally before 6pm. It got so packed as the night proceeded, and the restaurant wasn't small either! (It looked small from the outside but it wasn't when you walked in there.)  Our server had a very thick Irish accent so that was pretty entertaining haha.  It's a good place for some Irish food and drinks and.... is fish and chips Irish?

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dense bread kinda like German ones.
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious cavatappi bake with Irish cheddar and shrimp. Yummy!
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Malt beverage non alcoholic. Pretty good.

7mjGF4AcLJc8hdwxlKYSpg.text: Amazing fish and chips. Scottish deviled eggs, smash peas and potatoe cakes. Sat in bar - fast and friendly service!

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X_EVxDK1YGPclkGIUaUGpA.text: We were in Las Vegas 3 full days and ate here 5 times!! Food is AMAZING and we had 5 different servers and all of them were wonderful, but....Gavin was our favorite We at Breakfast, lunch, dinner 2x's and went in for dessert (Love the Bread Pudding & Snickerdoodle with ice cream)  For Great Food, Service and atmosphere this is a must stop!

onkHTPRCkWpTHtIKjoK_Rg.text: Boy am I glad that I was dragged into this place! The food they make here is just purely phenomenal. I came with a party of 10 - we were instantly seated without a reservation. The waiter was extremely nice and friendly. Honestly, you can probably close your eyes and point at any entree on the menu - it will turn out delicious.  My personal favorite is the Cider Glazed Pork Chop ($24). It's cooked perfectly and leaves you hungry for more with each bite. I ordered it medium rare - it was extremely tender and juicy. The oil from the fat layer around the protein just gushes when you cut through - make sure you soak it up with the meat cause it makes it that much better.  If you're a fan of fish and chips; make sure you try the one here ($20). The proportion of this is just gigantic! I've never seen such a large portion for the price of $20. Not only is the price well worth it, but the fish is just cooked to perfection as well - if cut through with your fork or knife, you can see the moisture retained in the fish.  The Ribeye Ragout ($23) is also very good. The ribeye is very tender and the flavor of this dish just... lingers.. In a good way. It really is an explosion of flavor - from the ribeye, to the mushroom, to the other spices they use.  The Chop Chop Salad ($12) is pretty good. A refreshing couple of bites after eating so much meat. The ingredients they use is definitely fresh!  Drinks here are at an expected price: A beer for $6.50. Long island and AMF for $9.50 each.  Overall, my first experience here was great! The only down part is that you cannot use your Mlife Express comps here.

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cider Glazed Pork Chop. You see that glaze...? Just mouthwatering.
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye Ragout

yUXrnlHlVysG7nQfgtXSfA.text: Great escape in busy Las Vegas. Intimate Irish pub right inside the Shopps off Mandala Bays casino. Live music, food, & beer and cocktails. I have been there several time over the past few years and it never disappoints; great food; great drinks; great service!

P9WS014eHiTS8HMacr3Lmg.text: Want to escape Las Vegas for a bit and feel like you are somewhere far away? This is the place to go. This pub was brought in from Ireland and placed in the mall. Step into a dark and authentic environment with great service, surprisingly good food and great music at night. It was a welcome break from a day of convention noise. They have all the drinks and Irish dishes you'd expect with American options as well. I'll be back.   Consider a traditional dish but don't pass over the burger. The fish and chips are first rate as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t3QLkwIS71bUOqv9-J1vuw.text: Interested in a savory Irish meal, good atmosphere and scratch adult beverages away from the countless chain restaurants on the Strip? Go here. Now.  Of all things to look forward to when in Vegas, my belly calls me back here time and time again. Never a bad meal, experience or eve spent. Tucked away in the hallways between casinos near the Mandalay Bay, it's definitely one to add to your list of places to try. Just love this place (in case you haven't figured it out).  My fave meal (and we've tried nearly everything on the menu) are the Bangers & Mash made on request - not on the menu but ask, proceeded by the Scottish Eggs - best ever, and a thirst quenching Moscow Mule - or two or three to compliment the experience. Or ale, the ale is good too. Portions are filling and shareable, comes hot and fresh. Can't say enough great things. Just go. You'll thank me later.  Love the staff's accents and good vibes, plus the service is top notch, so it's no surprise it's popular. Go early for less waiting and better seats. Decor is dark and pub like with TVs around for sports watchers and live music duo in the eves at the rear/back, or loud music other hours. Seating wise, it appears small but actually goes back pretty deep. We like sitting near the center for fun people watching. Enjoy!

uhgZTs11HjGQWMlNv3WN3A.text: We had plans to go elsewhere for dinner last night.  But we got stir crazy after a late afternoon of resting in our room at Luxor and decided to wander the Mandalay shops.  We'd wandered past Ri Ra  a number of times on this vacation and our last excursion to Vegas and it had caught our attention before but we'd never been.  There were several mouth-watering-sounding items on the menu, so we made the spontaneous decision to scrap our other plans and finally eat here. Slainte!  We got taken all the way back to the way back.  And this restaurant goes WAY BACK.  I'm sure the place seats a lot of people, it's much, much bigger than it looks from the outside.    They brought us water right away and were back before too long to take our orders.  I ordered the Rueben and my husband had the Shepherd's Pie.  The Reuben was among the best I'd ever had.  I actually even picked some of the meat off of the sandwich because it was more than I wanted inside the sandwich!  Husband had the Shepherd's Pie, and adventurous move for him because he wasn't sure he'd like all the vegetables in it (he's not the hugest fan of peas).  It worked out and he loved it!  We walked away feeling stuffed and satisfied, and very happy about our decision to do it.

YA9YPg46_Wlr0HC9N8NpAw.text: Great food! Great atmosphere! Great staff! We were seated quickly and food arrived in a timely manner.

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef &amp; Cabbage

I3KjuYGWSBttIdr30ZFa8A.text: Numerous authentic Irish dishes. Excellent food and drink options. The only downside is that the tables had super bulky foot pegs making it uncomfortable to place feet behind table and booth seat.

k8ah62pR8W0ccoXCLFkZwg.text: Best fish and chips in Vegas. Local's discount on Friday. Service was fast and food was piping hot.

9JGN6drEg0rpEDEsh0jd4g.text: I won't lie, I expected over priced mediocre food due to the location. I was pleasantly surprised. The woodwork inside is gorgeous. My chicken boxty was total comfort food. Great beer and whiskey selection.

UvrBa4OPTR-kMv3lfaBWyQ.text: My visits to Vegas have been more of a diversion and since I'm not a newbie, most of my trips come planned in advance with reservations at eateries I love or have yet to try.  That being said, given that our stay was not going to incorporate ethnic eateries (I can get Mexican and Asian food back home) we made reservations at a bunch of Americana spots or in this case, at an Irish spot located in the shops connected to Mandalay Bay.  While our journey here was albeit longer than the typical search for a breakfast joint, access is bia the mall, even if the mall is not open yet so bear that in mind.  Once inside, you are swept away to an envisioned Irish Pub.  If this is what a classic pub looks like, then I'm all game.  Their breakfast menu here is quite extensive and for those looking for direction, I would stick with something classic.  I ordered the Irish Breakfast, which came with the following items: The proper fry up of 2 eggs any style, Irish bangers & rashers, grilled black & white pudding, grilled tomato, sauteed mushrooms & toast.  Reason being, I wanted to try the grilled black and white pudding.  Please note that the platters here are huge, so there is no way you would be able to finish the entire portions.  The butter was the best part.........rich and creamy, like Darigold.    We gobbled up everything prior to heading back out to the strip.  5 stars for ambience, service, food, and just a great reason to get out of the Vegas heat.

MP4Pu8NpcAnNZpo1rlfwdQ.text: My first time in a Ri Ra was here in the Las Vegas location and created my life of Ri Ra.   The waitress was so nice and the restaurant to clean and orderly for such a bustling location.   Everything was so delish, hot and just perfect

tNunkCNLWlBCNZXn_IWajQ.text: Best Irish pub and food we've ever had! The servers were very humorous and friendly. We plan to make this our regular for when we visit Vegas again!

4-YIlzqpOhR02kGyTA-HJg.text: Considering my heritage is Irish and my name means Ireland and I feel bad I haven't been here sooner.  I loved this place! It's a quaint place with dark wood, great food, comfortable seats, servers who are Natives of Ireland, and bartenders who know how to pour a proper Guinness.   We were greeted by Maggie, an Irish girl through and through. She gave us some recommendations, brought our drinks and food in timely manners and chatted with us a bit about her homeland. I don't want to sound silly but her accent made our experience here more memorable.   The menu is huge and filled with good eats and not just boiled potatoes. We ordered a few "small plates" including the sausage rolls and potato cakes.  The rolls were a mild sausage surrounded with puff pastry and a sweet mustard sauce. Flaky dough and meat, how can you go wrong? The potato cakes were crunchy on the outside and filled with sharp cheddar and herbs. Served with a side of sour cream, they were devoured quickly.   Besides the bites we ordered the Guinness Stew and it was incredible! The perfect hearty warm comfort food you'd want on a rainy day like today. Tender pieces of beef, potato, veggies a dark Guinness gravy with creamy mashed potatoes on top. The flavors were rich and warm and I'm glad we listened to our servers recommendation and orders it. It's also served with a side of Irish Soda Bread and Kerrygold Irish butter! I could have taken a loaf home. The bread was so delicious and the butter was creamy and salty and better quality then what restaurants normally serve.   I'd love to go back for the live music they have later in the evening and another pint! Slainte!

photos.caption: Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato cakes.
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage rolls.
Photo of Rí Rá Irish Pub - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guinness Irish Stew! Yum!

Y1vZ4sy8j-aSQrILGfi51A.text: Cold food, over-cooked eggs, watery coffee.  The waitress did correct the coffee, but we were nearly done eating at that point,  Cute atmosphere, but I wish we had gone elsewhere.

4nwMXQweh6GvM2ABBjm41Q.text: Awesome Irish pub. It really felt authentic. I had a Reuben with a side of Brussel sprouts. Both were amazing. The Reuben had corned beef and was very thick. The ambience was very nice. We had an Irish waitress which was both nice and surprising. Would recommend and go again

zRqR3t_iiGCWCbE7nEFS6A.text: Ordered a couple of the apps, wings and  cocktail, both were delicious. Mains were The Shepherds Pie and Fish & Chips. Shepherds pie needed a little bit more seasoning and Fish & Chips were perfect. Drinks consisted of 12th & Crescent Rum libation and the Grapefruit, both were good, 2nd drink was on the sweeter side. Loved the fact that they had live music. Would definitely come back again.
